description:
To open-
In terminal, 
$links

Keyboard Shortcuts-
Esc + H to open help menu, click on Keys to see other shortcuts..

Navigation-
takes some time getting used to. need to memorise frequently used shortcuts.
It shows option to open new window. But how to seitch tabs is a mystery (to me).

KeyboardShortcuts(After opening app)-
Esc + Hk to see other shortcuts.
Esc + vo to open 'html options'.
s to open bookmarks menu.
q to exit.
g to enter url in text box.


search results look better in DuckDuckGo(they are enumerated lists & no weird chracters) than compared to Google & Bing(enumarated lists only).

Sites- 
reddit.com can be used.
washingonpost.com
edition.cnn.com

"Are you a robot" page-
bloomberg.com

Bookmarks-
Can be grouped into folders below the root bookmarks menu.
On Android; in Chromium & derivatives, you can't do that,(I never used it on others). 
Also, there are separate folder for Bookmarks and Links.

Dark mode-
Its a terminal app, its redundant for it. But the terminal can still be customised beforehand.

Quirks-
(both are different commands)
$ links -mode 1024x768x16M32
Graphics not enabled when compiling
$ links -g
Graphics not enabled when compiling

like to try a text mode browser becos the modern browsers are too heavy for simply browser hence run too slow.

compared with the repos version, this snap version does not:

- support grafx mode
- display non english characters (most important)

at the end i used a repo version of lynx instead.
summary: great text mode browser but with a few shortcomings

description:
This is a really good, fast console web browser. Not only it sometimes displays websites better than lynx (not always), but it is super fast, and if compiled with that option allows you to display images and use the mouse via GPM! Again, with no X installed. Awesome.

Also, very cool download manager embedded on it
The best Internet Browser for Console without Graphic Shell.
